goals.description: Integrate AI into daily workflow of every product manager within TAM
Automate intelligence-based repetitive work through AI integration
Ensure product managers orchestrate clear, maintained and relevant domain context

key_results.metric: Delivery and efficiency expectations
key_results.target: More and faster output from every team member

in_scope: Training and learning effective use of individual AI tools
Combining individual tools into comprehensive process
Establishing core principles for AI-augmented work
Reusing and expanding core components, assets, and artefacts
Building comfort level with GenAI
Understanding fundamental benefits and limitations of AI technology
Context-driven/spec driven development concepts
Ensuring all MAR/QARs and tactical reports are added to NotebookLM
deprioritized: Creating comprehensive documentation covering every aspect of product management
Focusing too much on existing products and tools
Assuming static reality where processes don't change

dependencies: HelloFresh AI exploration, deployment and integration initiatives
Global systems and unified tools per New Model

risks.risk: Increased expectations stretching team members without proper AI mitigation
risks.mitigation: Automation of intelligence-based repetitive work through AI integration

risks.risk: Over-reliance on AI without personal responsibility
risks.mitigation: Principle: Product managers remain personally responsible for all content, data, findings, and priorities generated

risks.risk: AI limitations and inappropriate use cases
risks.mitigation: Principle: Balance where to use AI; recognize AI cannot substitute creativity, passion, quality and communication

risks.risk: Technology in infancy with lack of strong product cases and existing limitations
risks.mitigation: Remain curious, flexible and quick; focus on building comfort level and understanding fundamentals

initiatives: GenAI Ways of Working implementation for TAM Product
NotebookLM integration for team reporting and collaboration
New Model implementation based on Assaf Ronen's proposal

entities.name: Nikita Gorshkov
entities.context: Author of the document

entities.name: Assaf Ronen
entities.context: Proposed New Model with core principles on 16.09.2025

entities.name: Leo Lee
entities.context: Contributor who reacted positively to context concepts

entities.name: HelloFresh
entities.context: Company actively engaging in AI exploration, deployment and integration

entities.name: HelloTech
entities.context: Technology division within HelloFresh with recalibrated efficiency expectations

entities.name: TAM Product
entities.context: Product team implementing context-driven product management with GenAI

entities.name: NotebookLM
entities.context: Tool for sharing team reports, MAR/QARs and tactical reports with stakeholders

entities.name: GenAI: MVP Product Workflow Automation
entities.context: Draft document this strategy is based on

entities.name: CFA GenAI Adoption 2025
entities.context: Related GenAI adoption initiative

entities.name: GenAI: Strategy for Design Workflows
entities.context: Related strategy document for design workflows

entities.name: Managing Directors (MDs)
entities.context: Own P&L for each geography in MD-Integrated Organization model

goals.description: Launch 'Recipe Creator' Marketplace MVP
Launch in Canada first
Transform HelloFresh into the 'Spotify for food' - a platform where any creator can share a recipe that HelloFresh fulfills
Create curated recipe creator marketplace with instant purchase as meal kit 'fulfilled by HelloFresh'

key_results.metric: Project phase completion
key_results.baseline: Phase 3: Prototype & Validate - MVP Blueprint, Sprint 4 week 1
key_results.target: Hand-over to Squad by Jan/Feb 2026

key_results.metric: New customer acquisition through social commerce
key_results.target: Attract new customers via influencer marketplace

key_results.metric: Recipe quality and completeness
key_results.target: Recipes scored on clear formatting and completeness with reliability meter

in_scope: Curated recipe creator marketplace (1. influencer, 2. Aggregators)
Instant purchase as meal kit fulfilled by HelloFresh
Verified Original Recipe badge for influencer-created content
Recipe scoring based on formatting and completeness
Reliability meter for recipes
Automatic flagging of recipes missing critical info (times, measurements, yields)
Prototype testing and validation
User research execution
deprioritized: Long-term vision: Full 'Spotify for food' platform (any creator can share)
Expansion beyond Canada market in initial phase

dependencies: Design assets and prototypes (Marc, Shay Obaidullah, Annette MvdE)
Bi-weekly gated decision approvals from stakeholders

risks.risk: Competitive threat - Influencers already solving problem with Instacart links; Pinterest partnering with Instacart for 1-click grocery lists
risks.mitigation: Act with urgency; differentiate with holistic offering (entire recipes + direct delivery vs individual food items)

risks.risk: Recipe quality and completeness issues
risks.mitigation: Implement Verified Original Recipe badge, recipe scoring system, reliability meter, and automatic flagging of incomplete recipes

risks.risk: Project timeline delays
risks.mitigation: Current status: On time; bi-weekly gated decisions with GO/NO-GO approvals

initiatives: User research plan execution (IXI Research Plan)
Design system development (Miro flowcharts, Figma assets, Magic Patterns prototypes)
Bi-weekly stakeholder presentations with gated decisions

goals.description: Launch Recipe Creator Marketplace MVP
Launch in Canada first
Transform HelloFresh into the 'Spotify for food' - a platform where any creator can share a recipe that HelloFresh fulfills
Create curated recipe creator marketplace with instant purchase as meal kit 'fulfilled by HelloFresh'

key_results.metric: Attract new customers through social commerce
key_results.target: Not specified

key_results.metric: Enable influencers to create new revenue streams
key_results.target: Direct revenue through HelloFresh marketplace

key_results.metric: Convert social media recipe inspiration into shoppable meal kits
key_results.target: Seamless purchase and delivery

in_scope: Curated recipe creator marketplace (influencers and aggregators)
Instant purchase as meal kit option
MVP prototype and validation
Canada first launch
Recipe scoring based on formatting and completeness
Reliability meter for recipes
Automatic flagging of recipes missing critical info (times, measurements, yields)
Save for later functionality
Q&A section for recipes
deprioritized: Long-term vision: Transform into 'Spotify for food' where any creator can share recipes
Full platform expansion beyond curated marketplace

dependencies: Design assets and prototypes (Marc, Shay Obaidullah, Annette MvdE)

risks.risk: Competitive threat - Instacart already partnering with influencers and Pinterest for ingredient ordering
risks.mitigation: Act now with urgency; differentiate with holistic meal kit offering vs individual ingredients

risks.risk: Recipe quality and completeness variability from influencers
risks.mitigation: Implement recipe scoring system, reliability meter, and automatic flagging of incomplete recipes

risks.risk: Influencers may not have properly formatted recipes with critical information
risks.mitigation: Score recipes based on clear formatting and completeness; flag missing critical info

risks.risk: Users may want to purchase later rather than immediately
risks.mitigation: Include save for later functionality in MVP consideration

initiatives: Flow charts and design assets in Miro and Figma

results.doc_title: 2025: AI Bytes - Operating Model & Core Strategic Pillars for Driving AI Transformations (v0.2: Action Plan)

goals.description: Spearhead integration of GenAI into product development lifecycle for consumer-facing experiences
goals.owner: Consumer Acceleration team (Consumer Foundation tribe, CSA)

goals.description: Launch AI Agents Platform for easier access to agents and agent experimentation at scale
Enable AI prototyping capabilities for designers and product managers
goals.owner: Priscila Koeck Machado with support from Pepijn Senders

goals.description: Automate product workflows using GenAI
Expand QA testing automation to other HelloTech teams

key_results.metric: Speed of handover from product to engineering
key_results.target: Improved through AI prototyping tools

key_results.metric: QA testing automation coverage
key_results.target: Expanded to other HelloTech teams with defined playbook

key_results.metric: Issue detection automation
key_results.target: Automated QA testing with better issue detection

in_scope: GenAI integration into product development lifecycle (requirements, UX/UI, development, localization, testing)
AI Agents Platform development and launch
v0 by Vercel evaluation for prototyping
QA testing automation expansion with Spurtest
Product workflow automation
Building foundational 'Library' components
AI literacy campaigns and enablement
1:1 coaching or office hours system for AI adoption

dependencies: Consumer Foundation tribe capacity allocation amid 'capacity wars'
Spurtest speed improvements or alternative tool selection (Playwright or other open source)
AI Agents Platform availability (end of September/October)
HC (headcount) constraints for official AI enablement group
Cross-team collaboration between CSA, Consumer Acceleration, and HelloTech teams

risks.risk: Capacity wars - Consumer Acceleration team packed with key top big bets till EOY
risks.mitigation: Operating model choice as key lever in defining success

risks.risk: Speed issues with Spurtest QA automation tool
risks.mitigation: Evaluate and consider opting into alternatives like Playwright or other open source setups

risks.risk: Information overload - old school text-based information sharing in GenAI world
risks.mitigation: Consider AI-powered alternatives for information consumption and enablement

risks.risk: HC (headcount) constraints for forming official AI enablement group
risks.mitigation: Not specified - flagged as discussion point

risks.risk: AI Agents Platform not available until end of September/October
risks.mitigation: Positioned as amplifier rather than blocker; removes user barriers when available

initiatives: Consumer Foundation tribe establishment in CSA
v0 by Vercel prototyping tool evaluation
AI Agents Platform Working Backwards development
AI literacy campaigns (inspired by Data Literacy campaigns)
Playbook of best practices and adoption plans for QA automation
5D Loop empowerment for Product & Design teams
